info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 11:42PM EST until December 27 at 8:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of western Caldwell County in western North Carolina * WHEN...Until 300 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1139 PM EST, Stream gauges indicated continued minor flooding along Wilson Creek in western Caldwell County. Water levels have been fluctuating but should continue falling overnight. Minor flooding will likely linger well into the early morning hours along Wilson Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of West Central Caldwell County - Flooding is most likely along Wilson Creek and nearby low- water crossings. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
